snippet: Priscilla Moronta, whose brother said she had jumped on the Mets bandwagon only recently, disputed his claim and provided photographic proof that she was a longtime lover of the team.
abstract: Priscilla Moronta contacts New York Times to dispute way her brother Michael Flores, in Times article, characterized her as having become New York Mets fan only after team's recent success; incident highlights way combination of baseball fandom and family dynamics can sometimes become explosive, and likely reflects battles going on between families and friends across two-team city as World Series approaches.
lead_paragraph: Priscilla Moronta, whose brother said she had jumped on the Mets bandwagon only recently, disputed his claim and provided photographic proof that she was a longtime lover of the team.

headline.print_headline: Siblings Feud Over Which Is True Fan of the Mets
headline.main: ‘We’re at War Now’: A Sister, Accused of Fair-Weather Mets Fandom, Fires Back
